title: ICE when using Box<T, A> with non-zero sized A

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
While working on #77438, I've run into the following ICE. ~~It seems to be caused by the type layout code not expecting `Box` to have more than 3 fields, in this case the fat pointer containing two fields, plus the `AllocRef` instance.~~ On further consideration, the issue also appears with `Box` as long as `A` is non zero sized. This ICE was likely not encountered during testing of #77187 because in the case of `Box`, `Global` is zero sized. In the example below, removing the borrow of `Global` will cause the compilation to succeed. @eddyb could you take a look at this? :) cc @TimDiekmann you may run into this as well on `RawVec` ### Code #### Old code [Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c75dfcd513b4b096cae70b1573a6a0d6) ```Rust #![feature(allocator_api)] fn main() { Box::new_in(&[0, 1], &std::alloc::Global); } ``` #### New, more minimal code [Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=389ae1cfe83cce69cabd968846eaab5a) ```Rust #![feature(allocator_api)] fn main() { Box::new_in((), &std::alloc::Global); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (fd542592f 2020-10-26) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu - playground rustc 1.48.0-beta.3 (4708ac76e 2020-10-15) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu - local dev environment ``` ### Error output https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/07e968b640e8ff76fa8be4b48b70ab80ea577800/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/layout.rs#L2056 ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: i < this.fields.count()', /rustc/fd542592f08ca0d1f7255600115c2eafdf6b5da7/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/layout.rs:2056:17 ```
Backtrace

From playground ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: i < this.fields.count()', /rustc/fd542592f08ca0d1f7255600115c2eafdf6b5da7/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/layout.rs:2056:17 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: rustc_middle::ty::layout:: for &rustc_middle::ty::TyS>::field 2: as rustc_codegen_llvm::type_of::LayoutLlvmExt>::scalar_pair_element_llvm_type 3: as rustc_codegen_llvm::type_of::LayoutLlvmExt>::scalar_pair_element_llvm_type 4: as rustc_codegen_llvm::abi::FnAbiLlvmExt>::llvm_type 5: rustc_codegen_llvm::mono_item::::predefine_fn 6: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit::module_codegen 7: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 8: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit 9: rustc_codegen_ssa::base::codegen_crate 10: ::codegen_crate 11: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 12: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 13: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 14: rustc_span::with_source_map 15: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```
